intro: Rinorea analavelensis, commonly known as the Madagascar velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
